epi-agent.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include <epi.h>
00002 
00003 /*
00004  * State changes occur when an agent is added or removed from a group,
00005  * or when an agent changes stage.  In either case, a check is made
00006  * to see if anyone becomes infected (change from stage 0 to stage 1).
00007  * The timer for the next event can be for a remove or for stage
00008  * transition.  Adds are performed by a message from another group.
00009  * Each agent has two possible times for the next event, the remove
00010  * time (ts_remove) and the stage change time (ts_stage_tran).
00011  */
00012 
00013 /*
00014  * Stage transition causes the agent to be removed from the
00015  * queue (it is at the head), increment the stage, collect
00016  * statistics, and place back in the queue with the minimum
00017  * of the next stage transition time and the remove time.
00018  */
00019 void
00020 epi_agent_stage_tran(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, epi_agent * a, tw_lp * lp)
00021 {
00022         epi_ic_stage    *s;
00023 
00024         // this agent is at head of pq
00025         a = pq_dequeue(state->pq);
00026 
00027         // simple error checking
00028         if(NULL == a)
00029                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Empty PQ!");
00030 
00031         // if this agent is contagious in the old stage, then reduce the location number of
00032         // contagious agents by one.
00033         s = &g_epi_stages[a->stage];
00034         if(s->ln_multiplier != 0.0)
00035                 state->ncontagious--;
00036 
00037         if(state->ncontagious < 0)
00038                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Less than zero ncontagious!");
00039 
00040         g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]--;
00041         a->stage++;
00042         g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]++;
00043 
00044         if (a->stage >= g_epi_nstages)
00045                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Invalid stage: %d", a->stage);
00046 
00047         s = &g_epi_stages[a->stage];
00048         //a->ts_last_tran = tw_now(lp);
00049         a->ts_stage_tran = tw_now(lp);
00050 
00051         if (fabs(s->max_duration - s->min_duration) < EPSILON)
00052                 a->ts_stage_tran += s->min_duration;
00053         else
00054                 a->ts_stage_tran += s->min_duration + 
00055                                 tw_rand_unif(lp->rng) * (s->max_duration - s->min_duration);
00056 
00057         if(a->ts_stage_tran > tw_now(lp) + s->max_duration)
00058                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Too long!");
00059 
00060         // Perform mortality check
00061         if(s->mortality_rate > 0 && tw_rand_unif(lp->rng) < s->mortality_rate )
00062         {
00063                 g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]--;
00064                 a->stage = g_epi_nstages;
00065                 a->days_remaining = 0;
00066                 g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]++;
00067 
00068                 // collect statistics
00069                 state->stats->s_ndead++;
00070         } else
00071         {
00072                 // if new stage has infectivity, 
00073                 // then increment location number of contagious agents.
00074                 if(s->ln_multiplier != 0.0)
00075                 {
00076                         state->ncontagious++;
00077                         state->stats->s_ninfected++;
00078 
00079                         if(a->behavior_flags == EPI_AGENT_WORRIED_WELL)
00080                                 a->behavior_flags = 0;
00081                 
00082                         // then must set number of days to stay home
00083                         if(!(a->behavior_flags & EPI_AGENT_WORK_WHILE_SICK))
00084                         {
00085                                 a->days_remaining = ((int) (a->ts_stage_tran - tw_now(lp)) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS);
00086                                 if (a->days_remaining < 1)
00087                                         a->days_remaining = 1;
00088 
00089                                 g_epi_hospital++;
00090                         }
00091                 }
00092 
00093                 if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00094                         a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00095                 else
00096                         a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00097 
00098                 // re-enqueue with new ts_next
00099                 pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00100         }
00101 }
00102 
00103         /*
00104          * Adding an agent means placing them into our PQ.  If agent
00105          * remove ts is < PQ->min, then must update LP remove timer.
00106          *
00107          * Check time for stage change.  Place in queue by minimum
00108          * stage change time or remove time.  Set timer for stage
00109          * change time (and event) or remove time (and event).
00110          */
00111 void
00112 epi_agent_add(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, epi_agent * a, tw_lp * lp)
00113 {
00114         // Test to make sure this location is this lp
00115         if (lp->id != a->loc[a->curr])
00116                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "epi_agent_add adding agent to lp %d but loc[%d] is %d",
00117                          lp->id, a->curr, a->loc[a->curr]);
00118 
00119         // if agent is contagious, increment number of contagious agents here
00120         if(g_epi_stages[a->stage].ln_multiplier != 0.0)
00121                 state->ncontagious++;
00122 
00123         a->ts_remove = tw_now(lp) + a->dur[a->curr];
00124 
00125         /* need to check stage time */
00126         if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00127                 a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00128         else
00129                 a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00130 
00131         pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00132 
00133         if(pq_get_size(state->pq) > state->max_queue_size)
00134                 state->max_queue_size = pq_get_size(state->pq);
00135 
00136 // If not at home, if agent is a worried well, if there are already enough symtomatic
00137 // people here then starting tomorrow, this agent will stay home for the number
00138 // of days remaining.  days_remaining is checked in agent_remove().
00139         
00140         if(!a->days_remaining && a->nloc > 1 && a->loc[a->curr] != a->loc[0] && 
00141                 (a->behavior_flags & EPI_AGENT_WORRIED_WELL))
00142         {
00143                 if ((float) state->ncontagious / (float) state->max_queue_size > 
00144                                 g_epi_worried_well_threshold)
00145                 {
00146                         a->days_remaining = g_epi_worried_well_duration;
00147                         a->behavior_flags = 0;
00148                 }
00149         }
00150 }
00151 
00152         /*
00153          * epi_agent_add_back: helper routine that adds an agent back to the
00154          *                     queue from which it was just removed
00155          *        Must call num_add if appropriate, since we are skipping
00156          *        the EPI_ADD event
00157          */
00158 void
00159 epi_agent_add_back(epi_state * state, tw_lp * lp, epi_agent * a)
00160 {
00161         // Need to move curr but not change location.
00162         if(++a->curr >= a->nloc)
00163                 a->curr = 0;
00164 
00165         a->ts_remove = tw_now(lp) + a->dur[a->curr];
00166 
00167         if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00168                 a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00169         else
00170                 a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00171 
00172         pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00173 
00174         epi_num_add(state, (tw_bf *) NULL, a, lp);
00175 }
00176 
00177         /*
00178          * When the LPs REMOVE timer fires, we should dequeue the next agent
00179          * and send it on to it's next location.  We must set the next remove
00180          * timer appropriately for the agents remaining in our PQ.
00181          *
00182          * If the remove is from location 0, then this is the first move of the
00183          * day, i.e., from home.  We activate agent logic to see if agent
00184          * will stay home today, due to quarantine, being ill, or having
00185          * ill spouse or children to care for.
00186          *
00187          * NOTE: We want the agent in the event to be consistent with the
00188          * agent in the timer, even if they have the same remove timestamp.
00189          * The reason for this is that in the reverse computation, I need to put
00190          * the agent back into the PQ, and where else can I get it from but the
00191          * timer event?
00192          *
00193          */
00194 void
00195 epi_agent_remove(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, tw_lp * lp)
00196 {
00197         tw_event        *e;
00198 
00199         epi_agent       *a;
00200 
00201         while(NULL != (a = pq_top(state->pq)) && a->ts_next == tw_now(lp))
00202         {
00203                 if(a->ts_stage_tran == tw_now(lp))
00204                 {
00205                         epi_agent_stage_tran(state, bf, a, lp);
00206                         continue;
00207                 }
00208 
00209                 a = pq_dequeue(state->pq);
00210 
00211                 // if stay-at-home flag is set, then set days_remaining > 0.  This
00212                 // causes everyone to stay at home
00213 
00214                 if (g_epi_stay_home > 0)
00215                         a->days_remaining = 180;
00216 
00217         // if days_remaining > 0, then go through motions by moving curr, but
00218         // do not move agent.  Thus, a->loc[a->curr] may not be home.  Need
00219         // to do this in order to send network traffic.
00220         // only change days_remaining at midnight, so when days_remaining goes
00221         // to zero, curr will go to zero and agent will be at home.
00222         // Make sure agent is at home.  If agent becomes worried well at
00223         // work, must continue to move until he is at home.
00224                 if(a->days_remaining && lp->id == a->loc[0])
00225                 {
00226                         if ((int) tw_now(lp) % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS == 0)
00227                         {
00228                                 if(--a->days_remaining)
00229                                 {
00230                                         epi_agent_add_back(state, lp, a);
00231                                         continue;
00232                                 }
00233                         } else
00234                         {
00235                                 epi_agent_add_back(state, lp, a);
00236                                 continue;
00237                         }
00238                 }
00239 
00240                 epi_num_remove(state, bf, a, lp);
00241 
00242                 // if agent is contagious, decrement number of 
00243                 // contagious agents in this location
00244                 if(g_epi_stages[a->stage].ln_multiplier != 0.0)
00245                         state->ncontagious--;
00246         
00247                 if (state->ncontagious < 0)
00248                         tw_error(TW_LOC,
00249                                 "Less than zero contagious agents in %d", lp->id);
00250         
00251                 // increment location
00252                 if(++a->curr >= a->nloc)
00253                         a->curr = 0;
00254         
00255                 e = rn_event_direct(a->loc[a->curr], 0.0, lp);
00256                 e->memory = (tw_memory *) a;
00257         
00258                 rn_event_send(e);
00259         }
00260 }
